settings.description: Allows users to control which applications can access the device camera, preventing unauthorized remote activation of cameras on Windows devices. Users can grant or deny camera access per application.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center
2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration > Create > New Policy
3. Select Platform: Windows 10 and later
4. Select Profile type: Device restrictions
5. Under General, configure 'Camera' to 'User is in control'
6. Assign to appropriate device groups
7. Verify deployment status

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting directly enforces the requirement to control remote activation of collaborative computing devices (cameras) by allowing users to explicitly manage camera permissions per application, providing indication of use.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with defined exceptions. Provide an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices.

settings.description: Allows users to control which applications can access the device microphone, preventing unauthorized remote activation of microphones on Windows devices. Users can grant or deny microphone access per application.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center
2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration > Create > New Policy
3. Select Platform: Windows 10 and later
4. Select Profile type: Device restrictions
5. Under General, configure 'Microphone' to 'User is in control'
6. Assign to appropriate device groups
7. Verify deployment status

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting directly enforces the requirement to control remote activation of collaborative computing devices (microphones) by allowing users to explicitly manage microphone permissions per application.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with defined exceptions.

settings.displayName: Force Allow Camera for Approved Apps
settings.description: Defines the explicit list of applications authorized to access the camera (organizational exceptions to the prohibition on remote activation). Example includes Microsoft Teams for business collaboration needs.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center
2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration > Create > Settings Catalog
3. Search for 'Let Apps Access Camera'
4. Select 'Let Apps Access Camera Force Allow These Apps'
5. Add PackageFamilyName for approved apps (e.g., MSTeams_8wekyb3d8bbwe)
6. Include 'NonPackaged' if Win32 apps need camera access
7. Assign to appropriate groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting implements the organization-defined exceptions where remote activation of cameras is allowed, explicitly authorizing business-critical collaboration applications like Microsoft Teams while blocking unauthorized apps.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: [Assignment: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed].

settings.displayName: Force Allow Microphone for Approved Apps
settings.description: Defines the explicit list of applications authorized to access the microphone (organizational exceptions). Example includes Microsoft Teams for business collaboration and conferencing.
settings.implementationGuide:

2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration > Create > Settings Catalog
3. Search for 'Let Apps Access Microphone'
4. Select 'Let Apps Access Microphone Force Allow These Apps'
5. Add PackageFamilyName for approved apps (e.g., MSTeams_8wekyb3d8bbwe)
6. Include 'NonPackaged' if Win32 apps need microphone access
7. Assign to appropriate groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting implements the organization-defined exceptions where remote activation of microphones is allowed, explicitly authorizing business-critical collaboration applications while blocking unauthorized apps.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: [Assignment: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed].

settings.description: Controls whether the device camera can be used at all. Set to 'Not configured' or 'Allow' to permit controlled camera usage with per-app permissions. Blocking completely prevents any camera use including authorized collaboration tools.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center
2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration > Device Restrictions policy
3. Select Platform (Windows, iOS, Android)
4. Under General settings, configure 'Camera' to 'Not configured' or 'Allow'
5. Note: Complete blocking prevents authorized collaboration tools
6. Use per-app privacy settings instead for granular control
7. Assign to device groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: While this setting can prohibit camera use entirely, it's better to use per-app privacy controls (IN-SC-001, IN-SC-003) to allow authorized exceptions while blocking unauthorized remote activation.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with defined exceptions.
